resources.string: Costa Rica official currency is called \"colon (CRC)\", here you can calculate how much are you going to pay using CRC as base:
Costa Rica is a country with a lot of cultures so you can find world wide food, but this is a list of the most traditional food you must eat
Pinto is the most traditional dish for breakfast (but you can eat it for lunch or dinner as well) It is made of rice and beans mixed up, you can find this all over the country
Meat pot is the a traditional soup made with beef and many vegetables, usually found all over the country
Chifrijo is a traditional dish made of rice, beans, \"Pico de gallo\" (tomato chopped mixed with species) and pork, ocaccionaly served with avocado and chips
A tamale is a corn-based cooked masa that is steamed in either banana leaves. Inside of the masa are fillings that generally include rice, meat, and vegetables.
Rice pudding is a typical dessert made by slowly cooking rice with milk and sugar. It is served hot or cold and cinnamon, vanilla or lemon peel is usually sprinkled on top to flavor it.

Picadillo de chayote is a very traditional Costa Rican recipe that combines the chayote fruit with traditional Costa Rican sofrito, spices, and cream. It is often served as a side dish to the Costa Rican casado, which is a main meal

Chorreadas are basically Costa Rican corn pancakes. They can be sweet or savory, and are made from ground fresh corn. They have similar ingredients to a corn tortilla but the fresh corn and milk give them a completely different texture.

Empanadas are a very popular food in Costa Rica, both because they are easy to make at home, but also because you can buy empanadas on the street in practically every location imaginable. Bean and cheese empanadas (empanada de frijol con queso) are a popular vegetarian type of empanada. Most other empanadas just have a single filling, but the bean and cheese are a fun take on the traditional filling.

The casado is the most traditional Costa Rican lunch- made up of rice, (black) beans, protein, vegetables- all on one plate. Since lunch is the main meal of the day in Costa Rica, the casado is the highlight of Costa Rican cuisine.
Error getting exchange rates values, please try again later

The Costa Rican vigorón is made from chicharrones (fried pork rinds or pork belly), a cabbage and chimichurri salad and with boiled yuca (cassava) and boiled green plantains in the mix, this dish is usually served cold.

rice and beans is a completely different recipe, as it combines red beans with rice cooked in coconut milk, and spiced with a bit of habanero pepper. The dish is said in English. Over time boiled chicken thighs were added as a side dish, and the result is beyond delicious.

Rice with Chicken is one of the most popular and traditional Costa Rican dishes, It is the official dish in any social event for example at birthday parties. Maybe because it is so simple to make and you can make it in advance so it is conveniently ready when your guest arrive.
This hot drink combines tapa de dulce (Costa Rican brown sugar) and boiling water/milk for a delightful treat.
This Costa Rican ceviche recipe combines fresh white fish marinated in lime, red bell pepper, cilantro, and onion. It’s a favorite worldwide- and the Costa Rican version is to die for.
Churchill is a dessert made up of ice, syrup, condensed milk, powder milk, ice cream and fruits,

Must of the places in Costa Rica takes Credit Cards (specially Visa or MasterCard), cash could be used on public transportations, souvenirs or buying street food. Some places might accept dollars cash on a lower exchange rate, so avoid overpay and try to get colons at the airport
Number too long, please use a lower value
The official national language of Costa Rica is Spanish, however English language, as well as the Portuguese, and many other languages, also are being spoken by a percentage of the population.
This is a kind of bread made out of old and dry baguette, milk, butter and sugar, some people add raisins to it, usually served with condensed milk
10% tip fee will be charged on your restaurant bill, so it is not mandatory to any extra amount, but it is up to you.
